sent_w_edu: <e>The owner of Moonlite BunnyRanch - Nevada's most famous legal brothel - describes getting a kiss from Marilyn Monroe and his desire to reclaim the word pimp from its negative connotations in his memoir, The Art of the Pimp.</e>
<e>Dennis Hof, 68, has become the object of desire for budding 18- to 21-year-old prostitutes through creating a sense of camaraderie in the word 'pimp'.</e>

<e>At BunnyRanch, which is featured on HBO's late-night reality show Cathouse,</e><e> he created a brothel where women could set their own prices and deals</e><e> but still split earnings with the house.</e>
<e>Scroll down for video .</e>

<e>Brothel: Dennis Hof, owner of Moonlight BunnyRanch, writes in his new memoir of his run-in with Marilyn Monroe</e><e> and includes first-hand accounts from ex-girlfriends that show what it was like to be with a pimp .</e>
<e>Life story: Hof, 68, opened his brothel in Lyon County, Nevada, in the early 1990s.</e>
<e>His goal was to train prostitutes in investing, sales and negotiating prices for sexual favors .</e>
<e>Hof starts his memoir with the story of how he got his first erection</e><e> - something he can thank Marilyn Monroe for,</e><e> according to the New York Post.</e>
<e>He was an eight-year-old boy at the Arizona State Fair</e><e> when he saw a 'gorgeous, red-lipped blonde' waving at him while filming a movie.</e>
<e>She kissed him on the cheek</e><e> and introduced herself as Marilyn Monroe.</e>
<e>And from then on, Hof sought out young,voluptuousblondes</e><e> to fill his fantasies.</e>
<e>He didn't start out in the brothel industry, however.</e>

<e>He owned five gas stations in the early 1970s,</e><e> but during the gas shortage of 1972, he began a deal with a local massage parlor:</e><e> He set aside gas for the women</e><e> so he could use their services whenever he liked.</e><e> '</e>
<e>I had always enjoyed sex, sure,' he writes,</e><e> 'but until [then] I hadn't realized how little I knew about it.</e>
<e>So, of course I kept going back, a willing student...</e>
<e>I soon realized I had a big problem:</e><e> I loved f****** and I couldn't get enough of it.'</e>
<e>And he then realized that he 'had fallen madly in love with prostitutes'.</e>
<e>He moved into real estate and became a regular at the Moonlight Ranch brothel in Mound House Nevada.</e>
<e>And when it went up for sale in the early 1990s,</e><e> he bought it for $1million in Lyon County, one of the only counties that still allows legal prostitution.</e>
<e>He changed the business's name to 'Dennis Hof's World Famous Moonlite BunnyRanch'</e><e> and trained all of the women in investing, sales and negotiating prices for sexual favors.</e>
<e>Entertaining read: The Art of The Pimp will be released for sale on March 17.</e>
<e>In the book he describes 'one man's search for love, sex, and money'</e><e> Smart money: Hof made sure the prostitutes were independent contractors</e><e> who could refuse any act or customer.</e>
<e>Earnings are split between the women and the house .</e>
<e>All the women: Hof started dating prostitutes</e><e> after realizing monogamy wasn't for him.</e>
<e>He made sure all the women were aware that he was having sex with others .</e>
<e>Hof made sure the prostitutes were independent contractors</e><e> who could refuse any act or customer.</e>
<e>But after realizingmonogamous relationships weren't for him,</e><e>he decided to date exclusively prostitutes</e><e> and made them all aware of his lack ofinterest in seeing only one woman.</e>
<e>According to him, however, all relationships ended</e><e> when the women found out he was having sex with other women.</e>
<e>Hof seems to have a realization</e><e> when during a recent conversation he had with his best friend, porn star Ron Jeremy.</e><e> '</e>
<e>It's not enough to be a good guy,</e><e> and it's not enough to buy them s***,</e><e> and it's not enough to teach them how to make serious money.</e>
<e>You have to give them your heart and soul.</e>
<e>If you hold back, even a little bit,</e><e> they know it, and it kills them.'. '</e>
<e>For f***'s sake, Dennis,' Jeremy said. '</e>
<e>You sound like a girl!'</e>
<e>In parts of his memoir he allows people to write pages of their experiences with him,</e><e> including working girls Krissy Summers and Cami Parker.</e>
<e>Summers's account of their relationship explains the first time they met in person,</e><e> after corresponding online for years, starting when she was a college freshman.</e>

<e>Friends: Hof, pictured center, with best friend Ron Jeremy</e><e> (left) and Joey Buttafuco, once told Jeremy</e><e> that it wasn't 'enough to be a good guy', because 'if you hold back...</e><e> they know it, and it kills them'</e><e> Narcissist: During a first-hand account of being in a relationship with Hof,</e><e> Cami Parker says that he tried to change the way</e><e> she looked constantly, because 'everyone knows Dennis likes skinny little-girl bodies'</e><e> 'I walked in and he said, "Hi, I'm Dennis Hof,"' she writes.</e><e> '</e>
<e>And I remember thinking, "I know who you are."</e>
<e>And then he said, "Take off your pants.</e>
<e>" That was it.</e>
<e>"Take off your pants.</e>
<e>" I was absolutely terrified.</e>
<e>Dennis was only the second man I'd ever been with.</e><e>'</e>
<e>Parker calls Hof a 'soulless pimp'</e><e> and explains the first time she arrived at the ranch, aged 22,</e><e> after seeing Hof on the Tyra Banks show.</e>
<e>When the girls met her they told her,</e><e> 'Daddy's gonna love you!' and asked if she would have sex with Hof.</e><e> '</e>
<e>Well, you want Daddy to like you.</e>
<e>You won't have a very good time</e><e> if he doesn't, so if he wants you to, you definitely should,' the women told her.</e>
<e>Parker ended up in a relationship with Hof,</e><e> but he tried changing the way she looked consistently.</e>
<e>She entered the ranch as a 5ft 4in, 107lb woman with A-cup breasts.</e>
<e>But Hof would 'forever tell me to lose weight',</e><e> and she hit '96 pounds with DDs',</e><e> which 'led to a very serious - and nearly deadly - eating disorder.</e>
<e>Everyone knows Dennis likes skinny, little-girl bodies'.</e>
<e>Hof eventually broke up with her - through another girl at the ranch -</e><e> because she was 'too old for him'.</e>
<e>She was 23, while Hof was 65.</e>

<e>Psychotherapist Dr. Sheenah Hankin writes a scathing review of Hof,</e><e> claiming he'encourages them to be jealous and yearn for his attention'</e><e> while laughing at 'how they bicker, bitch and fight with each other over him'.</e><e> '</e>
<e>Dennis uses the women he "loves" for his own desires, loyal companionship and sex,' writes Hankin.</e><e> '</e>
<e>Like any pimp, he exploits them.</e>
<e>This is sadistic behavior, and it is both unrecognized and denied.'</e>
<e>She calls him anarcissist, with 'no empathy',</e><e> who's 'clueless about his lovers hurts and fears or his part in creating them'.</e>
<e>Dennis Hof, 68, who owns Moonlite BunnyRanch in Lyon County, Nevada,</e><e> is releasing memoir titled The Art of the Pimp on March 17 .</e>
<e>Brothel is featured on HBO's late-night reality show CatHouse .</e>
<e>He created a brothel where women could set their own prices and deals, but still split earnings with the house .</e>
<e>Memoirfeatures first-hand accounts of relationships from ex-girlfriends .</e>
<e>A psychotherapistcalls him a narcissist with 'no empathy', who's 'clueless about his lovers hurts and fears or his part in creating them'</e>
